Posts.Content: bigmama124 wrote: I am very overwhelmed with all of the information out there on the pathology reports. My mother was just diagnosed, and I need help desiphering this information please!! This is what it reads; left breast-punch, R/O breasst CA, R/O infection IE: Fungal and Bacterial, think reaised plaque, patient has a history of breast cancer, do PAS. Then under gross description; Submitted is a .5 x.8 cm tan cylindrical skin segment. TS2 Microscopic Description; The epidermis is not remarkable. The Dermis shows an Infiltrative Neoplasm of epithelial cells in elongated strands extending throughtout the dermis. Can anyone translate this to lay mans terms?? I dont see anything about grades or hormone receptor status, all things we need to know right??   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: SO CONFUSED!! Help needed please!! bigmama124 bigmama124

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2011 12:25AM bigmama124 wrote: Thank you, I was thinking I am insane and just not able to read the dog gone thing and driving myself crazy!!  This was the first biopsy she's had done, should there be another with the information we are looking for? Perhaps after seeing the Oncologist or is this one to be continued? I guess I was expecting all of the information to be on the first pathology report and I'm wrong on that???.....
